question: A 2-month-old male child is brought to the clinic by his parents. He is found to have problems with lacrimation and photophobia. The cornea of both eyes is also large and hazy. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which type of scleritis usually presents with visual impairment and proptosis?

A 10-year-old boy presented to the outpatient department with complaints of decreased vision and photophobia in the right eye for 6 months. Which of the following is the most common cause of secondary cataract?

A 40-year-old man presented to the outpatient department with decreased vision in both eyes for the past 6 months. He has had diabetes for 10 years. What is the most common type of cataract in diabetes?
In the color blindness called deuteranopia, which type of color cone is lost?
Which visual field defect occurs due to a lesion of the left optic tract?

answers.option: Right heteronymous hemianopia with macular sparing

question: A 60-year-old man presented to the outpatient department with complaints of decreased vision and floaters in his right eye for the past few months. On examination, he was found to have detachment with shifting fluid. Shifting fluid is pathognomonic for which type of detachment?

A 25-year-old male presents with redness in his left eye for the past 3 days. He complains of mild discomfort and watery discharge but denies any vision loss. He recently had a cold. On examination, there is conjunctival injection and a follicular pattern on the palpebral conjunctiva. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 68-year-old white woman reports sudden, painless vision loss in her right eye upon waking this morning. Examination reveals a pale retina with a cherry-red spot at the macula. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old man complains of seeing flashes of light and floaters in his right eye for the past week. He now notices a shadow in his peripheral vision that is progressively enlarging. Fundoscopy shows a detached retina. What is the most appropriate management?

answers.option: Refer the patient for an ophthalmologist evaluation
Schedule a review in a week

question: A 60-year-old woman presents with severe eye pain, headache, nausea, and blurry vision in her right eye. She also sees halos around lights. Examination reveals a cloudy cornea, a mid-dilated pupil, and increased intraocular pressure. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 70-year-old man reports progressive vision loss in both eyes over the past 6 months. He struggles with reading and sees straight lines appearing wavy. Examination shows drusen deposits in the macula. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 3-year-old child is brought to the clinic with misalignment of the eyes noticed by the parents. Examination reveals inward deviation of the right eye. The corneal light reflex test confirms the diagnosis. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old construction worker presents with pain, photophobia, and redness in the right eye after accidentally being hit with a piece of metal. Examination reveals a corneal abrasion. What is the next best step in management?

answers.option: Irrigate the eye and prescribe topical antibiotics
Refer for fluorescein staining and apply a patch

question: A 55-year-old diabetic patient complains of gradual loss of vision. Fundoscopy shows neovascularization and cotton wool spots. What is the most appropriate treatment?
A 6-year-old child presents with swelling, redness, and pain around the left eye, associated with fever and decreased eye movements. What is the next best step?

answers.option: Treat with oral antibiotics and observe
Order an orbital CT scan and start IV antibiotics

question: A 70-year-old patient complains of blurred vision and difficulty seeing in bright light. Examination shows a cloudy lens. What is the most appropriate treatment?
A 35-year-old patient presents with redness, photophobia, and decreased vision in the right eye. Slit-lamp examination shows dendritic ulcers on the cornea. What is the treatment of choice?
A 45-year-old farmer presents with a fleshy, triangular growth on the nasal side of the conjunctiva encroaching onto the cornea. What is the most likely risk factor for this condition?
A 2-year-old child is brought to the clinic for a white reflex (leukocoria) noted by the parents in photographs. What is the most appropriate investigation?

answers.option: MRI of the orbit and brain

question: A 30-year-old patient presents with a painless swelling on the upper eyelid for 2 weeks. Examination reveals a firm, non-tender nodule. What is the best initial treatment?
A 28-year-old woman presents with sudden loss of vision in her right eye and pain on eye movement. Fundoscopy is normal. What is the most likely underlying condition?

A 55-year-old male with uncontrolled hypertension complains of blurred vision. Fundoscopy reveals arteriovenous (AV) nicking, flame-shaped hemorrhages, and cotton wool spots. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old patient presents with itchy, watery eyes, and mild redness, especially during spring. Examination reveals chemosis and papillae on the tarsal conjunctiva. What is the most appropriate treatment?

A 70-year-old hypertensive patient presents with sudden, painless loss of vision in the right eye. Fundoscopy reveals retinal hemorrhages in all four quadrants and a “blood and thunder” appearance. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 40-year-old woman with a history of hyperthyroidism presents with bilateral proptosis, lid retraction, and difficulty closing her eyes. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 60-year-old farmer presents with redness, pain, and a white patch on the cornea after a thorn injury to the eye. What is the most appropriate next step?

A 65-year-old patient presents for a routine eye check-up. Tonometry reveals increased intraocular pressure. Fundoscopy shows cupping of the optic disc. The patient denies any symptoms. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 45-year-old patient complains of difficulty reading small print, especially in dim light. His distance vision is normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 70-year-old patient develops pain, redness, and decreased vision in the right eye 2 days after cataract surgery. Examination reveals hypopyon in the anterior chamber. What is the next best step?

A 60-year-old diabetic patient presents with sudden, painless loss of vision in the right eye. Fundoscopy shows a hazy view of the retina with floating red blood cells in the vitreous. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 60-year-old woman complains of gritty sensation and burning in both eyes, worse at the end of the day. She also has a history of rheumatoid arthritis. What is the most appropriate initial treatment?
The oculomotor nerve enters the orbital cavity through a slit-like space known as the superior orbital fissure located between two bones. Which of the following bones encompass the orbital fissure?

answers.option: Greater and lesser wings of sphenoid bone

question: A 44-year-old male patient presents to the outpatient clinic with a progressive loss of temporal field of vision. Visual field testing confirms bitemporal hemianopia. When compressed, which of the following structures is most likely to result in this defect?

A 40-year-old male came to the eye outpatient department with a complaint of diplopia for the last two weeks. His corrected visual acuity was 6/9 in both eyes. On examination of extraocular movements, he was diagnosed with left eye superior oblique palsy. Which of the following statements is correct regarding the action of the superior oblique muscle?
A 15-year-old male had blunt trauma in the right eye by a tennis ball while playing cricket. He had a blowout orbital floor fracture. Which of the following bones forms the floor of the orbit?

answers.option: Greater wing of sphenoid, zygomatic bone
Orbital plate of frontal bone, greater wing of sphenoid
Lesser wing of sphenoid, orbital plate of frontal bone
Greater wing of sphenoid, lacrimal, maxillary

question: An 8-year-old child presented with complaints of fever and periorbital swelling. On examination, the child had proptosis and painful ophthalmoplegia. What is the treatment of this condition?

A 60-year-old male came to the eye department with gradually increasing pain in both eyes radiating to the temple and jaw. On examination, he was diagnosed with necrotizing scleritis. What is the most common cause of this condition?

A 30-year-old female presented with complaints of severe headache with vomiting from the last 5 days. On examination, she was diagnosed with papilledema. Which is the correct statement regarding papilledema?

answers.option: Horizontal diplopia may be present because of 3rd cranial nerve palsy
Papilledema is associated with sudden decrease in vision
Papilledema always shows relative afferent pupillary defect
Transient visual obscuration can be clinical presentation
Optic disc is pale in the early stage of papilledema

question: A 60-year-old male came to the outpatient department with the complaint of a noduloulcerative lesion at the lower lid of the eyelid for the last 1 year. Which of the following is the characteristic feature of basal cell carcinoma of the eyelid?

answers.option: Basal cell carcinoma is a metastasizing tumor
Histopathology of basal cell carcinoma shows characteristic keratin pearls
Basal cell carcinoma frequently arises from upper eyelid
Basal cell carcinoma is the most common eyelid malignant tumor accounting for 90% of all cases
Basal cell carcinoma is a rapidly growing tumor

question: A 5-year-old boy presents with complaints of bilateral recurrent itching each year on a seasonal basis with watery discharge. His visual acuity in both eyes is 6/6. Which of the following is the commonest sign of this condition?
Which of the following maintains the dark current in photoreceptors?
Which of the following is the key factor in binocular depth perception?
Which of the following is the first structure in the visual pathway where left and right eye inputs converge?
Which part of the eye is involved with specialized light-sensitive cells?

A 50-year-old female, a known case of diabetes, presents to the OPD with complaints of cloudy vision, sensitivity to light at night, and halos around lights. Scan biometry shows cataract in the right eye. Which part of the eye is involved?

A 50-year-old diabetic male came to the eye outpatient department with a gradual decrease in vision in both eyes. On examination, he had both eyes diabetic retinopathy with diabetic macular edema. Which of the following diagnostic imaging tests is quantitative for the assessment of retinal thickening in diabetic macular edema?

A 45-year-old male presented with redness in the right eye with severe pain. On examination, he was diagnosed as a case of right eye scleritis. Which of the following is the most common form of scleritis?

A 60-year-old male, a known case of hypertension, came to the eye clinic for a routine eye checkup. On fundoscopy, he was diagnosed as hypertensive retinopathy. Which of the following is the most common ocular vascular complication associated with hypertensive retinopathy?

A 40-year-old obese woman with a history of oral contraceptive pills presented in the eye outpatient department with complaints of transient visual loss in both eyes from the last 2 to 3 days. On examination, her visual acuity was 6/6 in both eyes. Pupillary reaction was normal in both eyes. Which of the following is the most common cause of this clinical ocular presentation?

A 40-year-old woman known case of Graves’ disease presented to the eye outpatient department with complaints of bilateral proptosis from the last three months. Corrected visual acuity was 6/6 in both eyes. Extraocular movements were normal. Which of the following specific findings seen on a CT scan is seen in this ocular condition?

answers.option: Homogenous opacification anterior to orbital septum
Enlargement of EOM but sparing of tendons

question: A 35-year-old obese female presented in the eye outpatient department with complaints of severe headache and vomiting from the last 3 days. On examination, the visual acuity was normal in both eyes. Fundus examination showed indistinct disc margins with tortuous vessels in both eyes. The most likely symptom of this condition is:

A 7-year-old boy presented in the eye outpatient department with complaints of fever with ocular swelling. On examination, he was diagnosed with right orbital cellulitis. Which of the following differentiates orbital cellulitis from preseptal cellulitis?

answers.option: Normal color vision in orbital cellulitis versus preseptal cellulitis
Ocular movement is painful but not restricted in orbital cellulitis versus preseptal cellulitis
Visual acuity is normal in orbital cellulitis versus preseptal cellulitis
Proptosis is absent in orbital cellulitis versus preseptal cellulitis
RAPD is present in orbital cellulitis versus preseptal cellulitis

question: A 45-year-old male presented in the eye outpatient department with complaints of deterioration of vision in both eyes for the last few months associated with a field defect. On perimetry, he had contralateral superior homonymous quadrantanopia. Which of the following is the site of lesion associated with this specific visual field defect?

A 20-year-old female presents sudden painless loss of vision in her right eye for two days. On examination, she has a visual acuity of 6/12 in the affected eye. The fundus shows a swollen optic disc. Which of the following will also be observed in this patient?

A 50-year-old man presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of decreased far vision while his near vision was normal (N/6) in both eyes. Ten years back, his far vision was 6/6, and he was prescribed +1.00 DS glasses for near vision. On examination, he was found to have cataracts in both eyes. What is the most likely type of cataract in this patient?

A 30-year-old male presented to the emergency department with complaints of pain, decreased vision, relative afferent pupillary defect, and floaters after a tennis ball injury to his left eye a few hours back. What is the most common cause of decreased vision in this case?

A 33-year-old patient presented with a complaint of foreign body sensation and burning sensation in both eyes for 2 weeks. On examination, the patient has matted eyelashes and hard scales on the base of the eyelashes. What is the most appropriate treatment for this patient?

answers.option: Washing eyelashes with normal saline 4 times a day
Removal of scales daily by forceps

question: A 7-year-old boy presents with drooping of the right eye since birth. Which of the following tests is most important regarding surgery for ptosis?
A 25-year-old male presented with a complaint of a well-defined small painless nodule on the upper eyelid for 4 months. The treatment for this lesion would be:

A 2-month-old baby is brought to the eye outpatient department with a complaint of white shine from the eyes. On examination, the patient has a white pupillary light reflex. What will be your next step in management?
Which of the following drugs used in the treatment of glaucoma works by increasing uveo-scleral outflow?
A 4-month-old baby was brought by his parents with a complaint of bilateral unusual big gray eyes and inability to tolerate light. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A cohort study investigates the relationship between smoking and lung cancer. It follows participants over 10 years and finds that lung cancer occurs more in smokers as compared to non-smokers. Which of Hill's criteria is most directly addressed by this study design?
A study on the relationship between air pollution and asthma shows consistent results across different countries and age groups. Which of Hill's criteria is being demonstrated in this scenario?

During a clinical trial, a participant signs an informed consent form but later decides to withdraw from the study for personal reasons. The researcher insists that the participant must continue completing the trial. Which ethical principle related to informed consent is being violated?
A student paraphrases content from an online source into their own words without citing the original source in their essay. Which type of academic dishonesty does this represent?
In phototransduction which protein activates cGMP phosphodiesterase?

A public health researcher conducts a study to determine the relationship between smoking and lung cancer in a population. He finds that smokers are 15 times more likely to develop lung cancer than non-smokers. Which measure of association is being used to express this relationship?

A community health worker is conducting a survey in a rural area to assess the prevalence of night blindness. She finds that a significant number of children under five years have night blindness. Upon further investigation, it is revealed that their diet lacks essential nutrients, particularly vitamin A. Which of the following interventions would most effectively reduce the risk of blindness in this population?

answers.option: Education on proper sanitation and hygiene
Fortification of staple foods with Vitamin A

question: A 28-year-old male came to the eye outpatient department with complaints of headache and decrease in vision. On examination, he had anisocoria. He was diagnosed as a case of Horner's syndrome. Which of the following is the correct statement regarding the feature of Horner's syndrome?

answers.option: Anisocoria is more marked in dim light
Facial anhidrosis suggests a lesion of third-order neuron

question: A 40-year-old female came to the outpatient department with complaints of sudden painful loss of vision in the right eye for 2 days. On examination, the visual acuity in her right and left eyes was 6/12. Her right eye intraocular pressure was 45 mmHg. She was diagnosed as a case of acute angle closure glaucoma. Which of the following is associated with angle closure glaucoma?

answers.option: More common in males than females
Associated with increase in anteroposterior dimension of the eye ball
Associated with posteriorly displaced iris lens diaphragm

question: A 60-year-old male presented to the eye outpatient department with a complaint of painless gradual decrease in vision over the last nine months. On examination, he had 6/12 corrected vision in both eyes. His intraocular pressure was 24 mmHg. Which of the following is the most appropriate feature of this condition?

answers.option: Presence of signs of secondary glaucoma
0.3 cup disc ratio of both optic discs
Focal field defects respecting the vertical meridian

question: A 6-month-old boy presented to the eye outpatient department with a complaint of watering and photophobia in both eyes since birth. On examination, he was diagnosed with primary congenital glaucoma. Which of the following is the most appropriate clinical feature of primary congenital glaucoma?

answers.option: Microcystic edema initially involves corneal stroma
Corneal diameter greater than 13 mm should be suspicious of glaucoma
Photophobia and blepharospasm result from the raised intraocular pressure
Epiphora, photophobia, and corneal edema are the classic triad of primary congenital glaucoma
Curvilinear break in corneal endothelium may be associated with congenital glaucoma

question: A 60-year-old male presents to the ophthalmology outpatient department with progressive bilateral vision loss over the past year. His medical history reveals uncontrolled diabetes for 15 years and a history of smoking for 25 years. What is the most likely cause of his visual impairment?
